intro: Tecticornia triandra, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, adapted to harsh environmental conditions. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss in dry climates. Tecticornia triandra is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil and withstand extreme temperatures.
